intro: Aetopteron braunii, commonly known as the Braun's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Aetopteron braunii is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
